citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.
citeinfo.title: Benthic Habitats of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida (NPS, GRE, BISC, BISCBEN)

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.
citeinfo.title: Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park

descript.abstract: The Benthic Habitats of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida data (BISCBEN) consists of area (polygon) benthic habitat units and the contacts/map boundary that defines those areas (polygons). The data were completed as a component of the Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE), a National Park Service (NPS) Inventory and Monitoring (I&M) funded program that is administered by the NPS Geologic Resources Division (GRD). The spatial data (coverage/theme) was produced from inherited data produced by NOAA. The data cover portions of Florida Bay in the southern part of the park, but not the entire submerged portion of the park. The coverage/theme (BISCBEN/BISCBENA) was attributed as per the NPS GIS-Geology Data Model. An indexed ArcInfo .E00 (export) coverage file and an ArcView 3.X .SHP theme were then also created. The coverage/theme is within the area of interest of Biscayne National Park. The coverage/theme is in NAD83, UTM Zone 17N.
descript.purpose: Data intended to assist NPS personnel in the protection and management of Biscayne National Park.
descript.supplinf: The Benthic Habitats of Biscayne National Park and Vicinity, Florida coverage/theme (BISCBEN/BISCBENA) is a component of the Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park. Other coverages/themes that comprise the Digital Geologic Map of Biscayne National Park include: BISCGLG (area geologic units and contacts), BISCSUR (surficial geologic units and contacts), BISCMIN (mine and mine related point features) BISCHZA (area geologic hazards), and BISCSEC (geologic cross section lines). Two accessory data tables, BISCGLG1 (accessory geologic unit data) and BISCMAP (source map information), are also considered map components.

idinfo.useconst: Not for use at scale greater than 1:126,720 (source map scale).
idinfo.datacred: Anne R. Poole, Heather Stanton the Florida Geological Survey and Thomas M. Scott

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service Geologic Resources Evaluation (GRE) program.

attracc.attraccr: Attribution was derived from inherited attribution and checked by visual comparison with a paper copy of the published NOAA source map. Users of this data are advised to FULLY and CAREFULLY READ the "DISTRIBUTION LIABILITY" section of this metadata before using the data.

dataqual.complete: Data is considered complete to the extent of the published NOAA source map.

horizpa.horizpar: Data, produced from inherited data produced by NOAA, is assumed to meet National Map Accuracy Standards. The PRECISION of the ArcInfo coverage .E00/ArcView .SHP theme file is DOUBLE.

citeinfo.origin: Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission Florida Marine Research Center
citeinfo.title: Benthic Habitats of Florida Bay, FL 1991-1995

pubinfo.publish: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Coastal Services Center

citeinfo.othercit: Florida Fish and Wildlife Commission Florida Marine Research Center, 1999, Benthic Habitats of Florida Bay, FL 1991-1995, CD-ROM: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Coastal Services Center,1:48000 scale

procstep.procdesc: Geologic contact and map boundary arcs were produced from inherited data produced by NOAA. Data features were converted to an ArcInfo coverage (BISCBEN) and coverage topology (ArcInfo BUILD command) was then constructed. Data Model attribution was derived from inherited attribution and from a paper copy of the published NOAA source paper map. If needed, the data were then 're-projected' (ArcInfo PROJECT command) into NAD83, UTM Zone 17N. An indexed (ArcInfo INDEX command) ArcInfo .E00 (export) coverage file and an ArcView 3.X .SHP theme were then also created.

cntperp.cntorg: National Park Service, Geologic Resources Division

procstep.procdesc: The data were imported into a geodatabase and topology was used to check for errors between and within data layers. Topological errors were fixed and the data was exported to coverages, corrected to the data model and converted to shapefiles.

distinfo.resdesc: BISCGRE.ZIP (ArcInfo coverages) or BISCGRS.ZIP (ArcView .SHP theme files)
distinfo.distliab:
The National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. The related graphics are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not appropriate to use the related graphics as data.
The National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an NPS server and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the National Park Service, no warranty, expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies to both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data.
